item.description: Structure Fire - Now Out; INC#1390; 05:28PM; 3231 N Amethyst St; #LincolnHeights; Two-story descending hillside home with light smoke showing. Firefighters made entry and found fire in one room of the ground level. It took 18 firefighters 16 minutes (5:22) from the time of alarm to extinguish the flames. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 47; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC2 E1 E16 E212 E47 RA47 T12; CH9; 14; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1200; 03:59PM; 10471 N Glenoaks Bl; #Pacoima; It took 30 firefighters 17 minutes to extinguish one mobile home and three adjacent vehicles that became involved with the fire. No reported injuries. The cause of the fire is under investigation.; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC10 BC12 E239 E24 E298 E7 E98 RA7 T39 T98; CH8; 17; Nicholas Prange

title.a: KNOCKDOWN Greater Alarm Structure Fire 03/02/2023 INC#1175

item.description: KNOCKDOWN Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#1175; 03:53PM; 220 S Hoover St; #Westlake; Firefighters arrived to find a two-story multi-family residential structure with fire showing. The attic was well-involved with fire, and partial involvement on the second floor. It took 67 firefighters 25 minutes to access, confine, and extinguish the flames. No reported injuries. The cause of the first is under investigation.; FS 6; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 13; BC1 BC11 BC5 CM20 CM22 E11 E13 E20 E203 E211 E220 E235 E3 E35 E6 EM11 RA1 RA11 RA6 SQ21 T11 T20 T3 T35 UR3; CH9; 13 14; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1200; 03:42PM; 10471 N Glenoaks Bl; #Pacoima; One mobile home burning, with flames threatening adjacent units on either side.; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC10 BC12 E239 E24 E298 E7 E98 RA7 T39 T98; CH9; 17; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1175; 03:28PM; 220 S Hoover St; #Westlake; Two-story fourplex with fire showing. Offensive mode.; FS 6; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 13; BC11 E11 E13 E211 E6 RA11 T11; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

Update Rescue; INC#1067; 03:15PM; 45 Pacoima Wash; #Pacoima; Firefighters located multiple individuals underneath the Laurel Canyon Bridge in the Pacoima Wash. They were on dry land near the rushing water. Firefighters set up a rope system for safety while operating near the water's edge. Firefighters assisted these individuals to a safer location on higher ground. No river involvement in this rescue, as originally reported to the Fire Department. No injury or medical problems. Nothing further.; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; AO1 AO2 BC12 BC14 BC17 CM40 CM42 E102 E260 E278 E298 E60 E7 E86 E88 E97 E98 EM14 FR91 H2 H4 HA2 HA4 HR3 RA60 RA86 SC1 SW44 T60 T78 T89 T98 UR88; CH5; 17 18; Nicholas Prange

River Rescue; INC#1067; 02:32PM; 45 Pacoima Wash; #Pacoima; Firefighters arrived on scene to find one person in the wash under the Laurel Canyon Bridge. Rescuers are setting up equipment to effect a rescue. MOTORISTS: Laurel Canyon will be closed from Fox St to Paxton St, as well as all 118 offramps in the vicinity, for the duration of the rescue.; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; AO1 AO2 BC12 BC14 BC17 CM40 CM42 E102 E260 E278 E298 E60 E86 E88 E97 E98 EM14 FR91 H2 H4 HA2 HA4 HR3 RA60 RA86 SC1 SW44 T60 T78 T89 T98 UR88; CH5; 17; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1664; 09:59PM; 3714 W Oakwood Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3ELYJXC; #EastHollywood; Just 200 feet from the front doors of Fire Station 6, firefighters arrived to find a vacant (boarded up) one-story home with heavy fire showing. It took 34 firefighters 27 minutes to extinguish the flames and protect nearby residential buildings. No reported injuries. The cause of the fire is under investigation.; FS 6; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 13; BC11 E20 E203 E211 E35 E52 E6 RA52 RA6 T11 T3; CH9; 13 14; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1664; 09:32PM; 3676 W Oakwood Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Z7HkAX; #EastHollywood; One-story single family home with heavy fire showing. Offensive mode. ; FS 6; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 13; BC11 E20 E211 E35 RA6 T11; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

Update Debris Flow; INC#0432; 09:30AM; 13150 W Mulholland Dr; MAP: https://bit.ly/3IXP6HI; #BeverlyCrest; LAFD Firefighters discovered one of several terraced retaining walls on a one-third acre residential property gave way, causing mud to cascade downhill, away from a 2,415 square-foot home, and onto nearby Mulholland Drive. There was no entrapment and no injuries have been reported. As the damaged retaining wall was 50' downhill from the residence, the home was not directly damaged. As a precaution, an elder male resident and his caretaker have been calmly evacuated from the premises, and are temporarily staying with a neighbor. #LATRraffic: Because the debris flow is threatening a power pole and mud remains on Mulholland Drive, that mountain top thoroughfare will remain fully closed between Coldwater Canyon Avenue (on the east) and Deep Canyon Drive (on the west) until L.A. City agencies can comprehensively assess and address the situation. Motorists should expect congestion, avoid the immediate area and monitor traffic reports on news radio. Though there has been strong rainstorm activity in the area, the Fire Department cannot determine the specific cause of the debris flow. LAFD Public Information Officer Captain Erik Scott is en route to assist the media, with an ETA of 10:00 AM.; FS 108; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 5; AO1 AO2 BC10 BC14 E108 E287 E288 E89 E90 E99 EM14 H3 H4 HA3 HA4 HR3 PI1 RA878 RA88 RA889 RA89 RA99 SC1 SQ87 SW88 T87 T88 UA2 UR88 UR89; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey
